title: Quiz 5: Instructional Media & Teaching Aids
topicName: Health Education Unit Five: Teaching and Learning Methodologies
description: Test your knowledge on the selection, preparation, and effective use of various teaching aids.

questions.question: Why is the 'Real Thing' (Real Object) considered the best teaching aid?

options.text: It is always free
It engages multiple senses and provides the most accurate experience
It requires no preparation
It is easy to store

questions.explanation: Real objects (e.g., a real baby vs. a doll) provide texture, movement, sound, and reality that simulations cannot fully replicate.

questions.question: Classify the following teaching aids as Projected or Non-Projected:
questions.explanation: Projected aids need electricity/light source (OHP, Slides). Non-projected do not (Flipchart, Flannel board).

questions.question: Which of the following are good guidelines for using the Chalkboard effectively? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Write large enough for all to see
Talk to the board while writing
Plan the board layout in advance
Stand aside so students can see what you wrote
Write down every single word of your lecture

questions.explanation: Effective board work involves legible writing, maintaining eye contact (not talking to board), and summarizing key points (not writing everything).
questions.hint: Don't turn your back on the class to talk.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ board consists of a surface covered with felt or flannel fabric, to which pictures backed with rough material (like sandpaper) adhere.
questions.explanation: The flannel board uses the friction between rough surfaces and the fabric to hold items in place without glue.
questions.hint: A type of cloth board often used in rural education.

questions.question: When preparing a transparency for an Overhead Projector, you should fill the entire sheet with as much text as possible to save space.
questions.explanation: Transparencies should have minimal text (rule of 10x10), large font (4mm+), and clear margins. Too much text is unreadable.
questions.hint: Is a wall of text easy to read on a screen?

questions.question: Order the steps for the effective use of teaching aids:

items.text: Select the appropriate aid based on objectives
Evaluate the effectiveness of the aid

questions.hint: Choose it, check it, use it, review it.

questions.question: What is a 'Handout'?

options.text: A substitute for a textbook
A written paper given to students to guide work or summarize main points
A test paper
A letter to parents

questions.explanation: Handouts support the lesson by providing summaries, diagrams, or instructions. They should not just replace standard texts.

questions.question: Name one technique for drawing on a chalkboard that helps create accurate diagrams using a cut-out shape.
questions.explanation: Templates (cut-outs of card/plywood) allow teachers to quickly trace accurate shapes (like maps or body organs) on the board.

questions.question: Which of the following is a DISADVANTAGE of using a Flannel Board outdoors?

options.text: It requires electricity
Wind may blow the pictures away
It is too heavy to carry
The pictures are too small

questions.explanation: Since the pictures just 'stick' by friction, wind is a major enemy of flannel boards in open-air settings.

questions.question: Why is it important to preview teaching aids before class? (Select all that apply)

options.text: To ensure equipment is working
To check if the content is accurate and legible
To plan exactly when to show it
Because it is a legal requirement

questions.explanation: Previewing prevents embarrassment from faulty equipment, wrong slides, or spelling errors.
